javax.xml.rpc.handler
Interface Handler

All Known Subinterfaces:
HandlerChain
public interface Handler

A handler provides a mechanism for processing of service context, plugging in additional RPC processing behavior and enhancing functionality of a JAX-RPC runtime system.

A JAX-RPC handler is required to implement the javax.xml.rpc.handler.Handler interface. An implementation class for the Handler interface is required to provide a default constructor.

Version:
0.6
Author:
Rahul Sharma

Method Detail

handleRequest

public void handleRequest(MessageContext context,
                          HandlerChain chain)
                   throws SOAPFaultException
The handleRequest method processes the RPC request message. Refer to the JAX-RPC 1.0 specification for details on the implementation of this method.
Parameters:
context - MessageContext parameter provides access to the request message.
chain - HandlerChain
Throws:
JAXRPCException - if any handler specific processing error happens
SOAPFaultException - if SOAP fault is generated by this handler

handleResponse

public void handleResponse(MessageContext context,
                           HandlerChain chain)
                    throws SOAPFaultException
The handleResponse method processes the RPC response message. Refer to the JAX-RPC 1.0 specification for details on the implementation of this method.
Parameters:
context - MessageContext parameter provides access to the response message.
chain - HandlerChain
Throws:
JAXRPCException - if any handler specific processing error happens
SOAPFaultException - if SOAP fault is generated by this handler

init

public void init(java.util.Map config)
The init method to enable the Handler instance to initialize itself. The init method passes the handler configuration properties as a Map instance. These configuration properties are used to configure the Handler (for example: setup access to an external resource or service) during initialization.
Parameters:
config - Configuration parameters for initialization of handler
Throws:
JAXRPCException - If initialization of the handler fails

destroy

public void destroy()
The destroy method indicates the end of lifecycle for a Handler instance. An Handler implementation class should release any resources that it had acquired over its lifecycle. The JAX-RPC runtime system invokes the destroy method, when the Handler instance is no longer needed.
Throws:
JAXRPCException - If any error during destroy
